item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Fran Tarkenton expresses disdain over Brett Favre and retirement indecision
item.description: Fran Tarkenton, who previously has expressed his loathing over Brett Favre's inability to make a decision, spoke out again Wednesday, a day after Favre decided to sign with the Minnesota Vikings.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: John Smoltz agrees to deal with St. Louis Cardinals
item.description: John Smoltz will resume his major league career, agreeing to a contract with the St. Louis Cardinals.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Denver Broncos' Brandon Marshall says he has trust issues with management
item.description: Brandon Marshall has no problem working with the scout team while he plays his way back into Pro Bowl form. What is bothering him is the way the Denver Broncos handled his acquittal on misdemeanor battery charges last week.

item.dc:creator: ESPNChicago.com
item.title: Grand jury dismisses felony charge against Patrick Kane, but indicts Chicago Blackhawks star on lesser charges
item.description: Grand jury dismisses felony charge against Patrick Kane, but indicts Chicago Blackhawks star on lesser charges.

item.dc:creator: Jayson Stark
item.title: Los Angeles Dodgers consider Vicente Padilla for rotation, source says
item.description: With right-hander Hiroki Kuroda's future availability still uncertain, the Dodgers have reversed course and have made Vicente Padilla "a consideration," according to a source who has spoken with Kuroda's agent, Paul Kinzer.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Terrell Owens will miss Buffalo Bills' next preseason game
item.description: A sprained toe will prevent Terrell Owens from practicing until next week, meaning he'll miss Buffalo's preseason game at Green Bay on Saturday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Usain Bolt dominates in semifinals, reaches 200-meter final at world championships
item.description: Usain Bolt dominated during Wednesday's 200-meter semifinals, looking to make a run on a second world record at the world championships.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Motion filed to dismiss Ben Roethlisberger lawsuit
item.description: A former Harrah's employee has filed a motion to dismiss a lawsuit that accuses Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger of raping another worker.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Gender test requested for 18-year-old runner
item.description: The IAAF has asked the South African athletics federation to conduct a gender verification test on an 800-meter runner amid concerns she does not meet the requirements to compete as a woman.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Ryan Church calls comments by New York Mets manager Jerry Manuel a 'low blow'
item.description: Ryan Church made it clear: He didn't appreciate those recent comments by Mets manager Jerry Manuel.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: David Jason Stinson pleads not guilty in Max Gilpin death
item.description: A former Kentucky high school football coach has pleaded not guilty to a charge of wanton endangerment related to a practice where a player collapsed and later died.
